Detailed Description

Describes a queue of packets.

The packets are inserted into the queue with the enqueue method and retreived with dequeue. The packets are returned in priority order. { { NB!} Internally an array that is Packet::m_nbrPriorities elements big is used, so if this becomes too large the implementation here might need to be changed.

Member Function Documentation

virtual Packet* PacketQueue::dequeue (  uint32  maxWaitTime  )  [virtual]
 

Get a packet from the queue, but don't wait more than maxWaitTime ms.

Parameters:
maxWaitTime The maximum time to wait for packets in the queue. In milliseconds.
Returns:
A packet from the queue or NULL if timeout.

Implements Queue.

virtual Packet* PacketQueue::dequeue (   )  [virtual]
 

Get the next packet from this packet queue.

This method will hang if no packet available. The packets are returned in priotity order (fifo within the same priority).

Returns:
A packet from the queue.

Implements Queue.

virtual bool PacketQueue::enqueue (  Packet *  p  )  [virtual]
 

Insert one new packet into this queue.

Parameters:
p The new packet to insert into this queue.
Returns:
True if the packet is inserted correctly, false otherwise.

Implements Queue.

uint32 PacketQueue::getFirstNonEmptyIndex (   )  [private]
 

Get the index if the first nonempty queue.

A value that is >= Packet::m_nbrPriorities is returned if no such queue.

virtual uint32 PacketQueue::getStatistics (   )  [virtual]
 

Get a value of the statistics for this queue.

Currently the length is used as statistics...

Returns:
A value that represents the load of this module.

Implements Queue.

void PacketQueue::terminate (   ) 
 

Releases the monitor by notifying all.

NOTE! This will make dequeue() return NULL.
